required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: FOSAMAX PLUS and FOSAMAX PLUS D Re-examination Study (0217A-267)
clinical_study.official_title: Re-examination Study for General Drug Use to Assess the Safety and Efficacy Profile of FOSAMAX PLUS and FOSAMAX PLUS D in Usual Practice

brief_summary.textblock:
This survey is conducted for preparing application materials for re-examination under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Laws and its Enforcement Regulation, its aim is to reconfirm the clinical usefulness of FOSAMAX PLUS / FOSAMAX PLUS D through collecting the safety information according to the Re-examination Regulation for New Drugs.
Note: FOSAMAX PLUS D is known as FOSAMAX PLUS in several markets. FOSAMAX PLUS (70 mg/2800 IU) and FOSAMAX PLUS D (70 mg/5600 IU).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to ~ 16 weeks and 14 days after treatment discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants that experienced Serious Adverse events (SAE). There was no required routine visit scheduled for AE assessment. AEs were collected through participant self-reporting and assessed by investigators. SAEs were considered serious if the event resulted in: death or was life-threatening prolonged an existing inpatient hospitalization a persistent or significant disability/ incapacity a congenital anomaly/ birth defect a significant medical situation, other important medical event based upon appropriate medical judgment of the investigator

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Unexpected Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to ~ 16 weeks and 14 days after treatment discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants that experienced unexpected Adverse Events (AEs) regardless of whether or not the AE was considered related to the use of the product. There was no required routine visit scheduled for AE assessment. An AE was defined as any unfavorable & unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the product. Any worsening (any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the product, was also considered an AE.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Non-Serious AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to ~ 16 weeks and 14 days after treatment discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable & unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the product, was also considered an AE. There was no required routine visit scheduled for AE assessment. AEs were collected through participant self-reporting and assessed by investigators.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Improved, Unchanged, or Worsened Disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of disease improvement was conducted in 3 categories of "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened". Changes in biochemical markers and vitamin D levels were reviewed before (baseline) and after treatment using statistical analyses to determine disease status, which was reported as either "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened".

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: For efficacy evaluation, changes in Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D were evaluated before study drug administration and at end of study drug treatment. Change was calculated as the later time point (at ~16 weeks) minus the earlier time point (baseline). The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) method was used. That is, the last observed non-missing value was used to fill in missing values at the later point in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Serum Osteocalcin at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: For efficacy evaluation, changes in Serum Osteocalcin were evaluated before study drug administration and at end of study drug treatment. Change was calculated as the later time point (at ~16 weeks) minus the earlier time point (baseline). The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) method was used. That is, the last observed non-missing value was used to fill in missing values at the later point in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urine Deoxypyridinoline at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: For efficacy evaluation, changes in Serum Deoxypyridinoline were evaluated before study drug administration and at end of study drug treatment. Change was calculated as the later time point (at ~16 weeks) minus the earlier time point (baseline). The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) method was used. That is, the last observed non-missing value was used to fill in missing values at the later point in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Alkaline Phosphatase at End of Treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: For efficacy evaluation, changes in Serum Alkaline Phosphatase were evaluated before study drug administration and at end of study drug treatment. Change was calculated as the later time point (at ~16 weeks) minus the earlier time point (baseline). The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) method was used. That is, the last observed non-missing value was used to fill in missing values at the later point in the study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D
arm_group.description: Patients with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS (70 mg/2800 IU) or FOSAMAX PLUS D (70 mg/5600 IU).

intervention.description: Patients with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS (70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D). One tablet taken once weekly.
intervention.arm_group_label: FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D

intervention.description: Patients with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS D (70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D). One tablet taken once weekly.
intervention.arm_group_label: FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D

study_pop.textblock: Patients with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who are treated with FOSAMAX PLUS / FOSAMAX PLUS D within label for the first time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have a contraindication to FOSAMAX PLUS / FOSAMAX PLUS D according to the current local label

group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D
group.description: Participants with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D. One 70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D tablet or one 70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D tablet taken once weekly.

group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D
group.description: Participants with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D. One 70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D tablet or one 70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D tablet taken once weekly.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: Number of participants that experienced Serious Adverse events (SAE). There was no required routine visit scheduled for AE assessment. AEs were collected through participant self-reporting and assessed by investigators. SAEs were considered serious if the event resulted in: death or was life-threatening prolonged an existing inpatient hospitalization a persistent or significant disability/ incapacity a congenital anomaly/ birth defect a significant medical situation, other important medical event based upon appropriate medical judgment of the investigator
outcome.time_frame: Up to ~ 16 weeks and 14 days after treatment discontinuation
outcome.population: Safety evaluation was performed in participants who took at least one dose of study medication and completed > 1 follow up visit.

group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D
group.description: Participants with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D. One 70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D tablet or one 70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D tablet taken once weekly.

Any worsening (any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the product, was also considered an AE. group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D
group.description: Participants with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D. One 70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D tablet or one 70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D tablet taken once weekly.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Non-Serious AEs
measure.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable & unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the product, whether or not considered related to the use of the product. Any worsening (any clinically significant adverse change in frequency and/or intensity) of a preexisting condition which is temporally associated with the use of the product, was also considered an AE. There was no required routine visit scheduled for AE assessment. AEs were collected through participant self-reporting and assessed by investigators.
measure.population: Safety evaluation was performed in participants who took at least one dose of study medication and completed > 1 follow up visit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Improved, Unchanged, or Worsened Disease
outcome.description: Evaluation of disease improvement was conducted in 3 categories of "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened". Changes in biochemical markers and vitamin D levels were reviewed before (baseline) and after treatment using statistical analyses to determine disease status, which was reported as either "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened".
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
outcome.population: Among 798 participants in safety evaluation, there was a total of 789 participants for efficacy evaluation excluding 8 participants who took study drug for < 4 weeks and 1 participant who did not enter efficacy evaluation.

group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D
group.description: Participants with Osteoporosis treated with FOSAMAX PLUS or FOSAMAX PLUS D. One 70 mg alendronate/2800 International Units (IU) Vitamin D tablet or one 70 mg alendronate/5600 IU Vitamin D tablet taken once weekly.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Improved, Unchanged, or Worsened Disease
measure.description: Evaluation of disease improvement was conducted in 3 categories of "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened". Changes in biochemical markers and vitamin D levels were reviewed before (baseline) and after treatment using statistical analyses to determine disease status, which was reported as either "improved", "unchanged", or "worsened".
measure.population: Among 798 participants in safety evaluation, there was a total of 789 participants for efficacy evaluation excluding 8 participants who took study drug for < 4 weeks and 1 participant who did not enter efficacy evaluation.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D at End of Treatment
outcome.description: For efficacy evaluation, changes in Serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D were evaluated before study drug administration and at end of study drug treatment. Change was calculated as the later time point (at ~16 weeks) minus the earlier time point (baseline). The Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) method was used. That is, the last observed non-missing value was used to fill in missing values at the later point in the study.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and End of Treatment (Up to ~ 16 weeks)
outcome.population: Among 798 participants in safety evaluation, there was a total of 789 participants for efficacy evaluation excluding 8 participants who took study drug for < 4 weeks and 1 participant who did not enter efficacy evaluation. Only participants with lab values submitted to Sponsor were included.

group.title: FOSAMAX PLUS/ FOSAMAX PLUS D

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
